label: 天児
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Protective charms kept at the bedsides of small children or sent downstream on their behalf at purification ceremonies (harae).  They were stuffed dolls, intended to represent children at the crawling stage. (p. 539) [祓]
